instruction.value: Remainder of dose administered as a continuous infusion over 8 to 16 hours, following direction injection of 25 mg.
Remainder of dose administered as a continuous infusion over 8 to 16 hours, following direction injection of 50 mg.
May administer as additional dose IF PTT remains prolonged 2 to 4 hours after first protamine sulfate dose.
Administer after stopping the heparin infusion.

units.value: mg/100 anti-Xa units of LMWH administered/dose

Population.value: NEONATE. Heparin dose administered within last 4 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is less than 30 minutes.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is 30 to 60 minutes.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is 60 to 120 minutes.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is more than 2 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin administered by direct IV infusion during the preceding 3 to 4 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin administered by deep subcutaneous injection.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Enoxaparin; time since last enoxaparin dose is less than 8 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Enoxaparin; time since last enoxaparin dose is 8 to 12 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Enoxaparin; additional dose where PTT remains prolonged 2 to 4 hours after first protamine sulfate infusion.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. LMWH (other than Enoxaparin); time since last LMWH dose is less than 4 hours.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. LMWH (other than Enoxaparin); additional dose where PTT remains prolonged 2 to 4 hours after first protamine sulfate infusion.
ADULT. Heparin (unfractionated) dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is less than 30 minutes.
ADULT. Heparin (unfractionated) dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is 30 to 120 minutes.
ADULT. Heparin (unfractionated) dose administered by direct IV injection and time since last heparin dose is more than 2 hours.
ADULT. Heparin administered by IV infusion.
ADULT. Heparin administered by subcutaneous injection.
ADULT. Dalteparin.
ADULT. Dalteparin; additional dose where PTT remains prolonged 2 to 4 hours after first protamine sulfate infusion.
ADULT. Enoxaparin; time since last enoxaparin dose is less than 8 hours.
ADULT. Enoxaparin; time since last enoxaparin dose is 8 to 12 hours.
ADULT. Enoxaparin; additional dose where PTT remains prolonged 2 to 4 hours after first protamine sulfate infusion.
INFANTS / CHILDREN. Heparin administered by direct IV infusion in the preceding 3 to 4 hours.

AdditionalNotes.value: Even with higher prtoamine sulfate doses, the PTT may be prolonged longer than seen with unfractionated heparin, as anti-Xa activity is never completely neutralized (MAX ~ 60%).
